title: Gorge & Cave Weekend
tagline: Get wet underground and in the gorges
suitableFor: Adventurous friends or groups who enjoy physical challenges and aren't afraid of getting wet and muddy. Must be comfortable with heights and confined spaces for caving.
notSuitableFor: Those with limited mobility, severe claustrophobia, or a strong aversion to cold water. This trip is not ideal for young children under 8.

stops.title: Gorge Walking with Adventure Britain
stops.description: Scramble up a stunning gorge in Waterfall Country, navigating waterfalls and natural pools.

wetAlt.title: National Showcaves Centre
wetAlt.description: Explore a network of impressive caves and dinosaur exhibits, staying dry and warm.

budgetAlt.title: Pantycellyn Waterfall Walk
budgetAlt.description: A free walk to a series of waterfalls, including Sgwd y Pannwr, with opportunities for paddling.

stops.title: The Old White Horse Inn
stops.description: A traditional pub serving hearty meals and local ales near Pontneddfechan.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Pontneddfechan picnic site
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your sandwiches by the river Neath near the Angel Inn.

stops.title: River Swimming at Sgwd Gwladys

wetAlt.title: Brecon Mountain Railway

budgetAlt.title: Explore the Elidir Trail

stops.title: Craig y Nos Castle

budgetAlt.title: Waterfall Country Campsite
budgetAlt.description: A campsite near Ystradfellte, providing basic facilities and a budget-friendly option.

wetAlt.title: Craig y Nos Castle Tours

budgetAlt.title: Explore the grounds of Craig y Nos Castle

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at a scenic viewpoint
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy sandwiches at a scenic spot near Aberdare, offering views of the valleys.

stops.title: BikePark Wales - Blue Trails
stops.description: Spend the afternoon mountain biking at BikePark Wales, with suitable blue trails for moderate difficulty riders.

wetAlt.title: BikePark Wales Cafe
wetAlt.description: Enjoy a coffee and relax at the BikePark Wales cafe, avoiding the rain.

budgetAlt.title: Taff Trail Cycle
budgetAlt.description: Cycle a section of the Taff Trail, a mostly flat and traffic-free route, for free.

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: The Brecon Beacons weather can be unpredictable. Pack for all conditions, even in summer. Waterfall Country is particularly prone to rain, which can make gorge walking more challenging and potentially lead to cancellations. Check the forecast before you go.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic can be heavy on the A470, especially during peak season and weekends. Parking at Waterfall Country can be limited, so arrive early or be prepared to walk from alternative parking spots. BikePark Wales can get busy, pre-booking is essential.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Gorge walking and caving activities with Adventure Britain MUST be booked in advance, especially during peak season. Accommodation should also be booked well ahead of time. BikePark Wales requires pre-booking.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: A moderate level of fitness is required for this trip. Gorge walking involves scrambling over rocks and wading through water. Caving can be physically demanding and require some crawling and squeezing. The Taff Trail is suitable for all fitness levels.
